content: When nesting tables within a TD, align center keeps it well, centered. Begin Template Container This holds everything together in a nice container Begin Template Preheader end layout-widget-wrapper end widget-span KDnuggets end layout-widget-wrapper end widget-span end header wrapper End Template Preheader Begin Template Wrapper This separates the preheader which usually contains the "open in browser, etc" content from the actual body of the email. Can alternatively contain the footer too, but I choose not to so that it stays outside of the border. end layout-widget-wrapper end widget-span  Self Service Analytics for All Members of the Data Team Whether your every day tool is Scala or Excel, you can now use a single platform to transform raw data to predictions without the hassle. Use notebooks (R, Python, Scala, Hive, Pig, Spark, etc.) or a customizable drag-and-drop visual interface at any step of the predictive dataflow prototyping process – from wrangling to analysis to modeling to running.  end layout-widget-wrapper end widget-span end layout-widget-wrapper end widget-span end layout-widget-wrapper end widget-span end widget-span end body wrapper End Template Wrapper Begin Template Footer Dataiku, 26 Broadway, New York City, New York, 10004, United States end widget-span end layout-widget-wrapper end widget-span end footer wrapper End Template Footer End Template Container

Dataiku: The Complete Data Sheet

Previous post
Next post

 
  http likes 20
Tags: Automated Data Science, Data Science Platform, Data Workflow, Dataiku

Whether your every day tool is Scala, Python, R, or Excel, you can now use one tool - Dataiku - to transform raw data to predictions without the hassle. Discover the platform!


KDnuggets

 Self Service Analytics for All Members of the Data Team

Whether your every day tool is Scala or Excel, you can now use a single platform to transform raw data to predictions without the hassle.

Use notebooks (R, Python, Scala, Hive, Pig, Spark, etc.) or a customizable drag-and-drop visual interface at any step of the predictive dataflow prototyping process – from wrangling to analysis to modeling to running. 

Dataiku, 26 Broadway, New York City, New York, 10004, United States
